author: sky.cactus
content: It has been brought up before, and may be reasonable as a long term strategy (e.g., after 1559), but it will likely break most tooling so it isn't considered a viable short term option.

author: sky.cactus
content: For example, we may say something like "legacy transactions will stop working in a year. After that you'll need to submit them through a precompile".

author: pipermerriam
content: it just hadn't occured to me yet and it seems like a nice way to both be able to fully deprecate them **and** still have a route where the long dormant paper wallet pre-signed something something legacy transaction can still be executed, albeit maybe with a little hoop jumping.
